title: net/mail.Header.Date can't parse Yahoo mail headers
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Parse an email with a header like: 

Date: Thu, 10 May 2012 11:07:14 -0700 (PDT)

2. calling mymessage.Header.Date() results in "mail: header could not be
parsed"

What is the expected output?
A proper time.Date struct to be returned.

What do you see instead?
An error

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
go run on 64-bit Mac OS X and FreeBSD

Which operating system are you using?
64-bit Mac OS X and FreeBSD

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.0.1

Please provide any additional information below.

Not sure if this is another case of the spec not matching with the real world, but Yahoo
webmail is pretty popular, and might be worth covering even if the spec doesn't.  See
attached patch for an example test that fails on data cut-n-paste from an email I
received.
Attachments: 1. yahoo.webmail.test.patch (587 bytes)
